dialogues.text: A car speeds along. CUT to a gravel DRIVEWAY leading up t wooden, traditional-style HOUSE. Kouichi, Asakawa’s father, is st before the entrance and puttering around in his GARDEN. The car previous shot drives up, comes to a halt. The passenger d and Yoichi hops out, running towards the old man. Asakawa wal leisurely after her son.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Grandpa!

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Whoa, there! So, you made it, huh? Caption-- “September 17th. Friday.”

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi says he’s looking forward to doing some fishing with you.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Is that so? Yoichi begins tugging excitedly at his grandfather’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: C’mon grandpa, let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: OK, OK. We’ll get our things together and then we can go. EXT. RIVER — DAY Asakawa stands on a RIVERBANK while her father and Yoichi on, are ankle-deep in a shallow river. Yoichi holds a small N Asakawa’s dad is pointing and chattering excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: There he is! C’mon, there he is don’t let him go! Yoichi tries to scoop up the fish his grandfather is poin

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Oh, oh! Ah... guess he got away huh?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: That was your fault, grandpa. Asakawa’s father laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Well, whaddya say we try again? He begins sloshing noisily out to the center of the strea in tow.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: We'll get ‘im this time. Asakawa looks away, pensive. INT. KOUICHI’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Yoichi is passed out asleep on the tatami mats. A TELEVIS inone corner of the living room, but it is switched off. SLIDING DOORS to the adjacent guest room are open and we futons set out, ready for bed. Asakawa enters the living room and, seeing Yoichi, scoops her arms and carries him over to the guest room.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: (sleepily) How was work, mommy? Asakawa tucks him into the futons and walks silently off. INT. KOUICHI’S HOUSE - STAIRCASE — NIGHT Asakawa stands at the foot of the staircase, telephone RE hand. The phone rests on a small STAND by the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Your Oshima contact came  through. It looks like the woman who predicted the Mihara eruption is the same woman from the video. INT. RYUJI’S APARTMENT — NIGHT Ryuji is crouched in front of the TV, REMOTE in hand. The paused on the scene of the woman brushing her long hair.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Her name is Yamamura Shizuko. She committed suicide forty years ago by throwing herself into Mt. Mihara. INT. KOUJI’S HOUSE - STAIRCASE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Have you got anything else?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna have to check it for myself. I’1l be leaving for Oshima tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Oshima? I’ve only got three days left!

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know. And I’ve got four. Short silence.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’1l be in touch. Ryuji hangs up. Asakawa, deep in thought, slowly places t back in its CRADLE. She turns around to walk back down th only to find her father standing there, face full of conc

dialogues.speaker: KOUJI
dialogues.text: What’s happened? Asakawa shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just had some things left over from work. She walks past her father, who glances worriedly after he shoulder.  INT. KOUJI’S HOUSE - GUEST ROOM — NIGHT The lights are all off and Asakawa is asleep in her futon suddenly fly open as a VOICE sounding eerily like her dec Tomoko calls out to her.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Auntie? Asakawa looks around the room, gets her bearings. Her eye the futon next to hers.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi? There is a BODY in that futon, but it is full-grown, dres black. It is curled into a fetal position and has its hea away. Suddenly, the IMAGE from the video of the figure with its shrouded springs to Asakawa’s mind. Just an instant, its visage materializes, and then disappears. It reappears a later, pointing more insistently now, and disappears agai Asakawa blinks her eyes and realizes that the futon next empty. Yoichi is nowhere to be seen. Just then, she hears that high-pitched, metallic SQUEAKIN video. Eyes wide with horror, she flings the sliding door --and there, seated before the television, is Yoichi. He is watching the video. It is already at the very last scene, the shot of the out CLOSEUP on the screen now, and for just an instant we can something is trying to claw its way out of the well. The off, and the screen fills with static. Shrieking, Asakawa races over to Yoichi, covers his eyes is already too late. She scoots over to the VCR, ejects the stares at it uncomprehendingly. She is then at Yoichi’s s shaking him roughly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi! You brought this with you, didn’t you? Why?!?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Tomo-chan...  Asakawa freezes, her eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Tomo-chan told me to watch it. EXT. OCEAN — DAY WAVES are being kicked up by a large PASSENGER SHIP as it its way. CUT to Asakawa and Ryuji standing on deck over the waves.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I should’ve been more careful. When I was at your place that day, I could feel something there. I thought it was just because of the video...

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You mean that Tomoko—

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: That’s not Tomoko. Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi... he can see them too, can’t he? Ryuji nods his head, lowers it sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: It’s all my fault. First Tomoko died, then those three others. It should have stopped there, but it didn’t. Because of me.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I wonder... Asakawa turns to Ryuji suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: How did the rumors about the video even start in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: This kind of thing... it doesn’t looking out  start by one person telling a story. It’s more like everyone’s fear just takes on a life of its own.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Fear...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Or maybe it’s not fear at all. Maybe it’s what we were secretly hoping for all along. EXT. PORT — DAY The ship has docked, its GANGPLANK extended. Ryuji and As the length of the gangplank towards the shore. A man name HAYATSU is already waiting for them. He holds up a white in both hands.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Mr. Hayatsu?

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Aah, welcome! You must be tired after your long trip. Please, this way. Mr. Hayatsu leads Asakawa and Ryuji to an awaiting miniva Caption-- “September 18th. Saturday.” INT. HAYATSU’S MINIVAN - DAY Ryuji and Asakawa sit in the back. Mr. Hayatsu is behind chattering away.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Back in the old days, the Yamamuras used to head fishing boats out in Sashikiji, though they don’t much anymore. You know, one of Shizuko’s cousins is still alive. He’s just an old man now. His son and his daughter-in-law run an old-fashioned inn. I went ahead and booked reservations for y’all, hope that’s alright... Asakawa gives the briefest of nods in reply, after which minivan lapses into silence. Asakawa looks dreamily out a mountain-studded landscape, then suddenly snaps to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ryuji) Why did Yamamura Shizuko commit suicide?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: She was taking a real beating in the press, being called a fraud and all sorts of names. After a while she just lost it. CUT to a scene of the minivan speeding along a country ro INT. HAYATSU’S MINIVAN — DAY Ryuji nods.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Shizuko was getting a lot of attention around the island after predicting the eruption of Mt. Mihara. Seems that for some time she’d had a rather unique ability: precognition. It was around then that she attracted the attention of a certain scholar whom you may have heard of; Ikuma Heihachiro.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: He was driven out of the university, wasn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: This Professor Ikuma convinces Shizuko to go to Tokyo with him, where he uses her in a series of demonstrations meant to prove the existence of ESP. At first she’s the darling of the press, but the next thing you know they’re knocking her down, calling her a fraud. Hmph. Forty years later the media still hasn’t changed that much. Asakawa continues, ignoring Ryuji’s barb.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I’ve heard this story. But... I’m sure I remember hearing that somebody died at one of those demonstrations. A strange look crosses Ryuji’s face. He looks away, igno for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: After getting kicked out of university, Ikuma just vanished, and no one’s been able to get hold of him since. He’s probably not even alive anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But, why even try looking for him?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Because he’s supposed to have had a child with Shizuko. A daughter. Asakawa freezes. In her mind, she sees a small FIGURE dre white, its face hidden by long, black HAIR. It is the fig the video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hayatsu leads Asakawa and Ryuji to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Hello? The INKEEPER, a middle-aged lady named KAZUE wearing a tr KIMONO, comes shuffling up. She addresses Mr. Hayatsu.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: Thank you. She turns to Asakawa and Ryuji. KAZUE (cont’d) Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Well, I’11l be off then. He gives a little bow and is off. Kazue, meanwhile, has p two pairs of SLIPPERS, which she offers to Ryuji and Asak

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: Please. Ryuji and Asakawa begin removing their shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kazue leads Ryuji and Asakawa up a shadowed, wooden STAI

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: And for your rooms, how shall we...?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Separate, please.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: ‘Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kazue gives a little bow.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: This way. Kazue turns to the right. Almost immediately after reachi top of the steps, however, a strange look crosses Ryuji’s He heads down the opposite end of the corridor, Asakawa c behind.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Sir! Ryuji flings open the SLIDING DOOR to one of the older ro There, hanging from one of the walls, is the oval-shaped MIRROR video, the one used by the mysterious lady to brush her l Ryuji stares at the mirror, almost wincing. He turns arou to look at Asakawa,but continues turning, looks past her. follows his gaze, as does Kazue. Standing at the end of t corridor is an old man, MR. YAMAMURA. Yamamura regards them silently, balefully. Breaking the s Kazue gestures for Asakawa and Ryuji to follow.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: (softly) Please, this way. Asakawa races past the innkeeper towards the old man. He back turned towards her.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Please! If you could just answer a few questions, about Shizuko...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got nuthin’ to say.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: It’s about Shizuko’s daughter. The old man says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: She did have a daughter, didn’t she? Yamamura regards her for a moment, then turns to walk awa

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: You’re wasting your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TABLE is laid out with an elaborate-looking DINNER. A sits alone, knees curled up to her chin, eyes wide and fr She is whimpering softly to herself. Just then, the DOOR open and Ryuji walks in. He sits at the table and picks u pair of CHOPSTICKS.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Aren’t you gonna eat?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Umm...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You'll stay with me won’t you? When it’s time for me to die.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. Asakawa scoots across the tatami mats towards the table, Ryuji fiercely by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You’1l stay, won’t you? If you stayed, maybe you’d learn something that could help Yoichi--

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I said stop it! Have you forgotten There was a girl with Tomoko when she died? That girl’s now ina  mental institution. Who knows what could happen.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But you could stay with me, Ryuji. You’d be OK.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (angrily) Why, because I’m already not right in the head? Asakawa releases her hold on Ryuji’s arm, lowers her head slams his chopsticks down angrily.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: If that’s the case, why not just let things run its course, get rid of father -and- son? Yoichi was a mistake, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Stop it! Short silence. When Ryuji speaks up again, his voice is s reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: We still have two days left... Just then the VOICE of the innkeeper calls tentatively ou the other side of the sliding door.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Come in. Kazue slides the door open. She stands hesitantly in the something tucked under one arm.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: It’s about Miss Shizuko. Ryuji shoots a glance at Asakawa and stands up from the t walks towards the innkeeper.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: This is all that there is... Kazue produces an old black and white PHOTOGRAPH. The ph WOMAN, seated, dressed in a KIMONO. A MAN in a Western-st stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Is this Professor Ikuma? Hearing this Asakawa leaps up, walks over to examine the herself.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: ..yes. This picture is from before I’d entered the household. She pauses a moment. KAZUE (cont’d) I should go now. The innkeeper scuttles off, leaving Asakawa and Ryuji alo photograph. Unbidden, the VOICE from the video enters the thoughts.

dialogues.text: Shoumon bakkari... boukon ga kuru zo...

Yamamura glances up to see Ryuji approach Ryuji takes a seat next to the old man, but it’s Yamamura first. The deep basso of his voice emphasizes the drawl o accent.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Y’all’d do best to be off soon. Sea’s probably gonna be rough tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: What kind of a child was Shizuko?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Shizuko was... different. She’d come out here by herself ever’day an’ just stare out at the ocean. The fishermen  all took a dislikin’ to her. Ocean’s an unlucky place for us, y’see: every year it swallows up more of our own. You keep starin’ out at somethin’ ike that...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Shoumon bakkari shite’ru to, boukon ga kuru zo. “If you keep playing in the water, the monster will come for you.” Yamamura looks at Ryuji, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Shizuko could see “inside” people, couldn’t she? Down to the places they’d most like to keep hidden. It must have been difficult for her... Yamamura rises unsteadily to his feet, features twisted a

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Please leave! Now! Ryuji stands, takes hold of Yamamura’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I’ve got a little of that ability myself. It was you who spread the word about Shizuko, wasn’t it? And you who first contacted Professor Ikuma?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: What’re you--?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: You thought you’d be able to make some money off her. You even got some, from one of the newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Leave me the hell alone! Mr. Yamamura strides angrily off. Both Ryuji and Asakawa pursuit, Ryuji calling out from behind Yamamura’s back.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Tell us about Shizuko’s daughter. Who was she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: She was there, with Shizuko. She had to be. Yamamura’s pace, which has become increasingly erratic, f causes him to stumble and fall. Ryuji comes up behind him grasping him firmly. At their touch Ryuji’s power awakens he peers into the old man’s mind there is a sudden blindi

dialogues.text: Ryuji eyes widen as he realizes he is seeing Shizuko’s de before the press. He also realizes--

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (to Yamamura) You were there!

dialogues.text: YAMAMURA SHIZUKO, the woman in the kimono, is sitting at onstage. Her face is calm and expressionless. Standing of side and peering from behind the curtains is a young Mr.

dialogues.text: You stood there and watched the demonstration. CUT back to the beach. Asakawa comes running up toward Ry the prone Mr. Yamamura. Suddenly there is another

Shizuko regards the pot and then places it gently on the table before her. She ta calligraphy STYLUS from the table, begins writing on a th rectangular sheet of RICE PAPER. dialogues.text: What are you trying to pull, woman? A SECOND REPORTER sitting in the front row also rises to

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Nobody made it. It wasn’t made at all. That video... is the pure, physical manifestation of Sadako’s hatred. Ryuji turns to regard Asakawa, his eyes blank.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: What about the fishing boats? Tell their captains I’1l pay.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Mr. Takayama!? Mr. Takayama... Asakawa, left alone, stares down at the tatami mats.

dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.text: (softly) Thank you... Asakawa slowly places the phone back in its cradle. Almos immediately, her face begins to crumple. She falls to her knees, sobbi the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (softly) Izu...

dialogues.text: Asakawa stands looking down on the wharf, scanning. Several FISHING BOATS are docked. The wind whips her hair around. She continues scanning, and suddenly she spies--—

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (calling) Ryuji! Asakawa runs down onto the wharf, heading towards Ryuji. in mid-conversation with Mr. Hayatsu.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Ryuji! The phone in my apartment never rang! It only ever rang at the rental cottage! Professor Ikuma must’ve...
